text: I had a similar issue where I read http instead of https, because I took the wrong header variableâ€¦ maybe you have the same issue.

Guys , big problem: *Original url must be hosted with HubSpot or manually marked as resolving.* 

I've migrated a website/domain that was not on HubSpot to HubSpot. I need to set up redirects for paths that don't exist on HubSpot and redirect them to paths that are on HubSpot, but the error I get is: "Original url must be hosted with HubSpot or manually marked as resolving." How do I mark it as resolving?

cc <@U01QVR44MEY> any suggestions?
you're using the redirect manager right?
don't include the domain, just put the path in. Should look something like this:
I have multiple domains on my Hub

I am using API `<https://api.hubapi.com/engagements/v1/engagements>`
but HubSpot activity is not updating in real time. I have to switch the tab to see the new feed.

I would post your questions in <#CFPRTEGTX|modules>
Interesting, can you share screenshots of your config?

Hi all, this is Aitana, I just joined this channel. I have been sent here from support and it's regarding the optimizations for the landing pages that present medium/high impact, high technical difficulty and with the role of developer. How and who can help me optimizing this in a few landing pages we have published? Thanks in advance

hey guys, thanks for the replies. So, I also used <http://webhook.site|webhook.site> and then recreated the requests locally in my test environment with a "transmitter" script for my receiver. It turns out the reason I wasn't able to validate my requests is because in my script, I was sending the request body in with the python function `json.dumps(...)`. However, this was automatically adding extra bytes of whitespace which made the request not truly match the intended V3 signature when applying the cryptography algorithm. It is working now. If anyone else has similar issues to discuss, let me know.
Using the hs_object_id or any id for that matter, how to recreate a HubSpot hyperlink? is there any format or convention to do so?

Hi, I am Moiz. I joined the community as I was being directed from the HubSpot chat support, here too. I am getting an API key error while integrating HubSpot with Brevo. Error image attached for review. If anyone could please help me out, it will be highly appreciated.

Hi <@U0750P1MFTR>
To get portal Id Go to you HubSpot account top right side where portal/ account name mentioned  open then menu you can see account section where account name and portal id is mentioned.

For get Form Guid go to forms and click on the form. Now from Url after /form form guid is mentioned you can use this to submit form using API
